div.header: To view the lottery results or apply for our waiting list:
div.p: click here. Enrollment packets for students selected in the 2020-21 Enrollment Lottery will be mailed to parents using the address provided in Lotterease. The school buildings are currently closed to parents under Governor Cooper’s Executive Order No. 120.

img.alt: Tech support isolated on blue square button reflected abstract illustration

h4.span: For Student Tech Support click the button.

section.p: Piedmont Community Charter School is a free college preparatory K-12 school, where students receive a well-rounded education focused on academics, character and community. Piedmont currently serves over 1300 students on two campuses. The new high school campus will open in August 2020. It will hold 600 students, which is 150 per grade level. Our students have exposure to a rich academic curriculum, diverse fine arts, competitive athletics and well- developed programs that celebrate and inspire excellent student achievement and character.

Piedmont scored in the top 20% in the state for exceeding academic growth. The Career and College Promise (CCP) program at Gaston College has a strong history with 52% of juniors and seniors dually enrolled in a tuition-free college program. Since 2012, Piedmont has provided every student 3rd grade and up with a laptop. The Charlotte Business Journal researched the high schools in seven counties in the Charlotte area. They ranked Piedmont #24 out of 129 high schools based on ACT composite scores. Piedmont students practice leadership skills for tomorrow by serving their community today. Click here to read more about our achievements.

h5.span: For the lottery application, click the button below.

span.strong: For employment, visit the “employment” page under the “about” tab.

section.p: The board meeting for Tuesday, April 21st will be a virtual meeting at 7pm. You can watch on livestream by clicking here. If you would like to submit public comments, please send them to board_of_directors@pccharter.org before the board meeting.

p.span: PaySchools is our online payment processing system.

span.strong: School Report Card for 2017-18 – 78 B Exceeded Growth

section.p: Governor Roy Cooper directed that all schools in North Carolina will be closed starting Monday and will remain closed until at least March 30th. Monday will be a teacher workday. These two weeks will be teacher workdays for our staff. Our hope is to have that assessment completed by Tuesday. Our goal is to begin digital instruction the second week. We have received guidance from the NC Department of Public Instruction (DPI). Please be patient with us as this is unchartered territory for all of us. Our plans could change daily as we receive new information and guidance from NC DPI. We will keep you informed as those plans are updated.

a.title: Head of School Announces Middle School Director
Head of School Announces Middle School Director

h3.a: Head of School Announces Middle School Director

section.p: In July 2020 when the New Hope Road location transitions to a 5th through 8th grade campus, Piedmont Community Charter School Elementary Assistant Director, Sheila Richards, will step into the role of Middle School Director. Head of School, Jennifer Purdee, shares, “I am thankful to have such an experienced leadership team that is committed to servant leadership for the staff, students and families at Piedmont.”
